review: Arrived in a very timely manner.  Easy to set up and install. Voice recognition works well.  Maybe I haven't learned to properly use it yet, but I find it wants to navigate back to Prime TV.  Example, I want to watch 'Shark Tank' on You Tube.  I navigate to Youtube and say 'Shark Tank", it always goes back to Prime with episodes of 'Shark Tank" for pay.  I have played very little to see if I can figure a way around this.
author: Greg W.

Must be my NY accent!

author: Debra Todd

review: As an Amazon Prime and Netflix subscriber this is a good little device with lots of potential.The voice search is a great feature.However, Amazon, I hope you read these reviews and give us what we want added to this device.It needs:Support to attach an external USB Hard Drive for playing local content. Ie. .mkv, .mp4, .avi etcSupport to share my attached content over my home network.Support to install apps to the attached USB device.I would like to load some games to the device but the available storage is very limited.
author: Gary Hancock

review: This is the 3rd viewer I've owned (well, including a Wii).  This has been by far the best.  I have some of these functions built into my "smart" TV but it is sluggish and hard to navigate.  It is so nice to have NetFlix and Amazon in the same device!  The Fire TV is blazing fast to navigate! The voice recognition is amazing.  Only drawback to voice is the search only works on Amazon's media, it doesn't include apps in the search. The YouTube app is really nice, especially after you integrate your google account.  This allows you to navigate on an iPad or phone and basically move it over to your TV to watch.  We cut the cord to cable a couple of years ago so this little box gets a lot of action - we worth the low price.
